Ross 1.description: The first ever Ross Server. Created in April of 2019 as a server between {p,zandgall,Zandgall}, {p,LordStarscream,Starscream}, soon to join {p,larzerboy,larzerboy}, then evolving into a Minecraft Realm to host a larger group of people.

0.name: Construction of the Trollface
0.description: A trollface was constructed over the base of {p,LordStarscream,Starscream} and {p,zandgall,Zander}, {b,0,Turtle Island}, early into the life of {s,Ross 1,Ross 1}. Created by {p,baconwaffle3213,Isaac}, by stretching the first google result of "trollface" in microsoft paint, to dehance the quality of the image and translate it into pixel art as an awesome prank.

1.name: Beginning of Ross 1
1.description: This is where it all began. {s,Ross 1,Ross 1} started out as a server, intended to be played by {p,zandgall,zandgall} and {p,LordStarscream,LordStarscream.} Soon after launch, {p,larzerboy,larzerboy} was introduced.

images.caption: Earliest known screenshot of Ross

2.name: Beginning of Ross 2
2.description: Ross 2 has easily been the most eventful Ross-related server or realm to date. With the most active players, and the most being done day by day. It began as a world-reset of Ross 1, intended to attract new players like {p,TheOwen05,TheOwen05} and {p,I_C_Evan,I_C_Evan.}

3.name: Splatoon
3.description: Splatoon was a small fun event in the {b,5,Creative Area} on {s,Ross 1,Ross 1.} It was a minigame that you could play by grabbing named bat-spawn-eggs, and spawning them in the arena in order to change a small radius of wool blocks into the color that the bat spawn-egg specifies.

images.caption: The workings of the splatoon event.

4.name: The Chunk Error
4.description: The chunk error was a dug out chunk in {s,Ross 1,Ross 1} at {b,18,Spawn} by {p,lazytagger,lazytagger}, {p,BaconWaffle3213,BaconWaffle3213}, and {p,zandgall,zandgall.}

images.caption: The water-filled chunk-error.

5.name: Winter Spawn
5.description: For a brief period of time, the {b,18,Spawn} of {s,Ross 1,Ross 1} was 'winterized' for December and the holiday season. The ground around spawn and {b,32,Dub's Village} was changed into snow-blocks, spruce trees were planted all around, and a candy cane elytra course was build {i,0}. Once the event was over, spawn was refurbished with plants and trees and green grass everywhere{i,1}.

images.caption: A slight glimpse at the spawn Christmas event, you can see spruce trees planted everywhere, along with a candy-cane themed elytra course.
The refurbished spawn showcased, just a slight touch, but it made spawn feel a little prettier and alive.

6.name: Admin Items
6.description: Admin items made an appearance in Ross 1, in the form of knockback sticks and items, and custom maps. The knockback items were often used for sumo dueling in the {b,16,Arena.} The custom maps were simply for fun, and could have been placed anywhere.

7.name: Final Item Grab
7.description: At the end of {s,Ross 1,Ross 1}, {p,zandgall,zandgall}, {p,BaconWaffle3213,BaconWaffle3213}, {p,Grey_Phantom777,Grey_Phantom777}, {p,LordStarscream,LordStarscream} and {p,DubTron,DubTron} formed an event to find and collect all Minecraft items and store them near {b,18,Spawn.} Unfortunately, no actual screenshots of the results exist, but the list of collectable items is still hosted on Google docs. https://docs.google.com/document/d/1BQN2-j8VkNRI3KQIY7zDPTRAekIFRv_cw32Q6R1BnjM/edit

8.name: Ross 1 Court Case
8.description: On {s,Ross 1,Ross 1}, there was a court case involving {p,lazytagger,lazytagger}, {p,NoobRekt,NoobRekt}, {p,BaconWaffle3213,BaconWaffle3213}, and {p,zandgall,zandgall.} The reason for this court case is unknown, though lazytagger in the past had duped items, and it seems likely that this was the case.

9.name: Creative Area Events
9.description: Several minigame events were created in the {b,5,Creative Area} by {p,larzerboy,larzerboy} and {p,zandgall,zandgall.} These minigames often had to do with fighting off hoards of mobs in an enclosed space. The first was a big spiral spire, with spawners strewn about. The mobs at the lower levels are easier compared to the enemies at the very top. Once you reach the top, you can get inside a room and block the enemies out, winning the game{i,0}. Another is a big closed off village with a big central house you can hide in{i,1}{i,2}. And the series of rooms, a hallway of rooms where each room contains a challenge of enemies you have to fight off in order to progress to the next room{i,3}<sup>-</sup>{i,7}.

images.caption: Inside the spire, you can see spawners around.
The horde village.
The outside of the horde village, with command blocks that summon all of the horde in rounds.
The series of rooms.
The first room, brewery.
The second room, farm.
The third room, bedroom.
The fourth, and empty, unfinished room.

10.name: The Rules (Ross 1)
10.description:
The law was a small part of {s,Ross 1,Ross 1}, after some of {p,DubTron,DubTron's} items went missing, he and {p,zandgall,zandgall} thought it would be entertaining to create a set of laws, a courthouse, and a police station. The set of laws read as follows:

PvP RULES
=========
1: Self defense is allowed if provoked
-------------------
2: You can only be provoked if the offendant uses a weapon
-------------------
3: Unjust killing results in 2 crimes, Murder and Battery


GAMERULES
=========


KeepInventory - true


MobGriefing - true


RandomGameTick - 20


COURT RULES
===========


Jury must consist of 2+ individuals


Judge must be a mod


1+ witness present on the realm at the time of the crime required


Crime must be given by Zandgall (Owner)


COURT RULES
===========


Defendant and Plaintiff are their own lawyers


Defendant must attend, failure results in court evasion crime


CRIME AND PUNISHMENT
===================


Murder - Death + 10 iron fine


Mass Murder (3+ players) - Death + 2 diamonds fine


Battery - 1 iron fine


"OwO" - Death


CRIME AND PUNISHMENT
===================
(Valuables) Theft - Return items + 1 Diamond fine


Arson/Griefing - Death + 3 day ban + 10 diamond fine


Court Evasion - 2 iron fine per evasion


CRIME AND PUNISHMENT
===================
Failure to pay fines in 7 irl day - 1 diamond fine per day missed


Mass Criminal, (10+ crime) - 10 diamonds fine


Hacking - 64 (legit) diamonds fine + 1 day ban


CRIME AND PUNISHMENT
===================


Abuse of glitches - 1 day ban + 32 (legit) Diamond fine


REPORT ANY WITNESSED CRIMES TO ZANDGALL, DUBTRON, OR OTHER MODS


These rules weren't really upholded, as they were kind of just for fun, as far as {s,Ross 1,Ross 1} goes.

events.name: RocketPowered
events.description: RocketPowered was a coalition between {p,zandgall,zandgall} and {p,DubTron,DubTron.} Usually spending their time as a group building and maintaining farms and shops.

builds.name: Turtle Island (Ross 1)
builds.description: This was the first ever base constructed on {s,Ross 1,Ross 1}, marking it's opening as a small server between {p,LordStarscream,Starscream} and {p,zandgall,Zander} alone. This base lived on Turtle Island, what was originally world spawn on Ross 1. The base consisted of a tower, mostly consisting of storage. A basement with a broken attempt at a SethBling infinite storage System {i,4}. The island featured a lot of farms, as well as the first rendition of {b,2,BaconWaffle3213's Terracotta shop}{i,5}. This is also the location where BaconWaffle3213 built the {e,0,Trollface.}

images.caption: The island as a whole
The island from the view of the farm
The {e,0,trollface} that was built above the island by {p,BaconWaffle3213,BaconWaffle3213}
Small underground basement
An attempt at SethBlings infinite storage system which used Minecarts in order to fit a theoretically unlimitted amount of items in a small space.
{b,2,BaconWaffle3213's Terracotta Shop}
An early rendition of the island, after {p,larzerboy,larzerboy} joined, but before {p,BaconWaffle3213,BaconWaffle3213} joined.

builds.name: Larzerboy's Base
builds.description: This base, built by {p,larzerboy,larzerboy}, was the second base ever to be built on Ross, let alone {s,Ross 1,Ross 1}. It began as a small little cobblestone shack just north of {b,0,Turtle Island}. Soon after it transformed into a hill-side base further up north with a watchtower. And finally, it transformed once again into a birch beach-house on an island in the middle of a coral reef, with an oak ship containing a portal to the {b,4,Nether Hub}

images.caption: The inside of the newest base
The water shaft up to the inside
The ship containing the portal to the {b,4,Nether Hub}
The second rendition of larzerboy's base
Inside the second version
A staircase up to the watchtower in larzerboy's second base
The first rendition of larzerboy's base

builds.name: BaconWaffle3213's Terracotta shop
builds.description: BaconWaffle3213's Terracotta shop is technically the first shop on {s,Ross 1,Ross 1}, selling Terracotta. It started on {b,0,Turtle Island} as a little pop-up stand, but soon migrated to {b,18,Spawn}, where it became a rainbow concrete building. The stock later expanded to include coral blocks and fans, for 32 blocks or 16 fans per diamond, as well as 3 stacks of terracotta per diamond. With the unique pricing of being able to mix and match different types of Coral fans and blocks, as long as you round out with 16 fans or 32 blocks in the end.

images.caption: The first rendition of the shop, living on {b,0,Turtle Island}
A top view of the shop at spawn.

builds.name: BaconWaffle3213 Base (Ross 1)
builds.description: Temp description extra extwra

images.caption: The humongous bamboo forest stretching out around BaconWaffle3213's base.
The unfinished giant glass sphere.
The inside of the first main area, where chests used to line the walls.
The stream leading out to the nearby ocean.
The inside of the second main area, above the basement area.
The basement area, with a pumpkin and melon farm, and chests below.
The Chest area, along with a trollface graph showing company profits.
The American Flag
An outside view of the base, with the sphere and first main area visible.
Another view with the second main area visible
A house on top of the base, containing chests full of snowballs

builds.name: Nether Hub (Ross 1)
builds.description: The central nether hub on {s,Ross 1,Ross 1}, connected to almost all bases. It started as a small unorganized set of ice-tunnels, before being transformed into a set of stone-brick ice roads with sea lanterns connecting almost all the portals in Ross 1.

images.caption: A wide view of the central nether hub, holding the portal to spawn.
Portal to {b,0,Turtle Island}.
Portal to {b,2,BaconWaffle3213's base}.
Junction that includes a portal to  {b,1,larzerboy's base}.
Portal to the {b,17,End}.
Portal to the {b,15,Ocean Monument}, with a portal to the {b,16,Fighting Arena} in the background to the right.
A long bridge to the {b,14,Decorative Lava Cast Ruins}.
Portal to {b,30,DubTron's base} with the main portal to Spawn in the background.
Pathway to {b,24,Grey's base}, with a portal to the {b,5,Creativity Area} in the background.
Portal to {b,42,Zandgall's base}, further down the corridor past the creative portal.

builds.name: Creative Area (Ross 1)
builds.description:
This was an area on Ross 1 intended for players to design, build, and play around in creative mode while remaining in the same world. It began{i,0} just as a small designated area away from spawn where people could step into a room in order to switch between creative and survival. It was then flattened into a superflat section of land, where people could only get in and out through the {b,4,nether hub}. Later again it was slightly altered so that the complicated command block barrier was changed into a barrier-block-casing.

There have been several minigames created here, most notably is a {e,3,Splatoon} arena{i,1}, but also a few mob-fighting arenas and minigames.

images.caption: The image used to announce the opening of the first rendition of the creative area.
An image of the {e,3,Splatoon Arena}
A decorative area
A decorative arena-looking build.
One example of many piston doors designed and built in the creative area.
One of a few water elevator contraptions built.
Super ultra mega awesome chicken farm.

The creative area border that was supposed to prevent anyone from getting out in creative mode, it would clear your inventory and switch you into survival mode if you flew over it, and it killed any ender pearls that flew above it.
The creative area entrance, with barrier blocks and command blocks to transfer a player in and out of the creative area if their inventory is empty. With a portal to the {b,4,Nether Hub}

The most complete screenshot of the creative area. Post command-block-border, past the most recent available backup of the world. Including a barrier-block-only border, and some new prevalent builds. Notably, 2 Minigame areas beyond what's been covered before, such as a tower filled with spawners, intended for the player to reach the top without dying. As well as a set of white rooms where enemies would spawn and you would have to survive, similar to two of the other minigames shown in this creative area.
The transformation of the creative area from a small region into a superflat set of chunks with a border.

builds.name: Evan's Base (ROSS 2.0)
builds.description: Evan's ROSS 2.0 Base was on the edge of the ocean surrounding spawn island, floating just over the water. Built and finished over the course of the day Novermber 5th, the base was a completely illegal build, being built using a combination of /fill and /give commands. The base was intended to be a parody of {p,TheOwen05,TheOwen05}'s base, with obvious choices made to be opposite of his. Instead of being a floating white box, it was a floating black box. Instead of hallways which extended out of the box to exterior rooms like TheOwen05's base, Evan's base was mostly contained and filled with walkways suspended within the box, most walkways were useless and didn't connect to any rooms. The base had two rooms which extended out from the box, one room being "The Garden of Evan", and one room being a white tower room. Both rooms would eventually inspire future projects related to ROSS; {s,The Garden of Evan,The Garden of Evan}, and Evan's Illegal Tower, the latter of which got Evan's server operator status removed.

builds.name: Evan's Illegal Tower
builds.description: The Illegal Tower was a project of builds just outside of Evan's ROSS 2.0 base which were controversial for the overt cheating used to create them. Started on the evening of November 6th, the design for the tower was inspired by a room that extended out from Evan's base, which became a model for how the tower would look in aesthetic and design. Being built largely in the evening of November 6th into the morning of the 7th, the project was undertaken by Evan and Isaac in creative mode. The project consisted of a building on the land just outside the tower which connected to the tower, the tower itself, and a raised platform made of melons, glass, sea pickles, and fences, which sat outside the tower. During the beginning of the build, Miles and TheOwen05 also joined in the process of building the tower, but only for the first two floors. The tower was 11 stories tall, 10 of the floors were a repeated circular design with later additions like external rooms or interior decoration, and the 11th floor was a large domed room (with a higher and lower level, aquarium ceiling, and minibar) which had a larger floor area than the floors below it. On November 8th, the towers floor plan had been completed, and Evan anounced he intended to allow ROSS server members to reserve a floor on the tower which they could customize. This prompted question from zandgall and TheGreyWolf, who were concerned about the obvious cheating so close to spawn. Another issue with the build was server lag; Isaac, Evan, and Miles had covered the melon platform outside the tower with Polar Bears and Dolphins, and zander had to kill a few hundred entities from the chunks around the platform. After the controversy, the project was largely abandoned (however largely completed as well), and Evan was removed of his server Operator permissions, ending his run of command cheating on ROSS 2.0. On December 14th, it was discovered someone had filled a large amount of the negative space in the Tower with Planks, Evan suspects to this day it was TheGreyWolf.

builds.name: The Tavern
builds.description: The Tavern was a build by Evan on ROSS 2.0, Started on September 1st and finished on September 2nd. It is the only build by Evan not related to a controversy or server event. The Tavern was built just offshore of the mainland closest to spawn island, laying just behind the cemetary and adjacent to where Castaway Island would be created. The Tavern was not a shop, nothing was offered and Evan did not actually ever work the tavern, it largely just became a meeting place somewhat popular for being a short distance out from spawn island. Evan's Tavern for a long time also had a "donation's chest", which is where Evan asked for help in starting out on the server, as he had only joined a day before starting the Tavern, and had also indebted himself for the materials (like terracotta) to build the Tavern.

builds.name: Bread with YOUR Name on it (ROSS 2.0)
builds.description: Bread with YOUR Name on it was a "shop" at spawn built by Evan, completed on November 11th. Created as a joke, it was meant to be an obvious novelty item scam, where Evan proposed a transaction of 2 diamonds for only one Bread, which was put into an anvil to say whatever the person buying wanted. The shop was also an incredibly ugly build, it was built using a junk shulker of unused leftover stones like granite, diorite, and andesite, and had a two-block tall ceiling. When the shop was first opened, Zander and Isaac joined Evan in the building of the shop and started turning the shop into a pillar tower using all of the blocks from their junk shulkers and chests, creating a comically ugly tower which was close to reaching build height. This tower became another Evan-related controversy, as TheGreyWolf demanded the shop be removed. Ultimately, zander upon completing the tower had the world reset to just as we were starting the tower, but allowed the shop to stay. Evan and Isaac were vocally frustrated about this, but the argument ended there.

builds.name: Christmas Area
builds.description: The Christmas Area was a large-scale build for the ROSS 2.0 Christmas event -which actually happened on Christmas Eve. The project was proposed by Evan to Zander on October 18th, and was worked on intermittently until the day of the event. The build was special for a few reasons, it had it's own dedicated resource pack, it was designed exclusively for the event, and it was permissed as a creative mode server build. Zander created the resource pack, and it was made first by taking a resource pack which ripped some of the assets from the Festive Mash-Up Bedrock texture pack, then adding many custom textures and sounds to it, eventually becoming it's own server-exclusive pack, the ROSS ChristmasPack. Evan did most all of the builds in the Christmas Area, although Zander helped out with a large part of the Rollercoaster. A few days after the project had started, Zander gave Evan server operator permissions to work on the area, a decision which had many ramifications later in the server history.

builds.name: Ocean Shop
builds.description: The Ocean Shop was the only true shop built by Evan at spawn, and was built and opened on October 31st. The shop was illegal, Evan built the shop in survival before using creative mode inventory to stock the chests. Frankly, it was pretty obvious too, the shop sold perfect stacks of the most odd ocean items, plus Evan refused to restock the chests. It really only was allowed to stay open due to the humor of consistently selling Squishy-Go-Pops. This shop was the first illegality committed by Evan on ROSS 2.0 using Operator permissions, in time that permission would be taken away after the completion of his illegal tower.

builds.name: Original Head Trading Hall
builds.description: The Head Trading Hall was a "shop" at spawn built by Evan, completed on December 28th. While not truly a "shop", the Head Trading Hall was something between a legitimate trading hall and a  gold-brick scam, the idea was to introduce value to the Player Heads (a server addition from ROSS World Datapacks) by commodifying and trading around the most unique player heads on the server, creating an economy around them. While the business of trading heads never went anywhere on the server, people did begin to somewhat develop an endowment effect ot the player heads they had already collected, and so the value of displaying your own heads did begin to become popular. This shop inspired the Second Head Trading Hall, which was built later in ROSS 3.0 by Evan.

builds.name: Ooga Booga Land
builds.description: Ooga Booga Land was an area on ROSS 2.0 which corresponded with the server event by the same name. On December 29th, three members (HappyHamster65, QeorgeW, markiplierfan) from the Wanker Crew discord server joined ROSS 2.0 for the first time. Evan and Miles joined them in touring spawn, but ultimately the five of them decided to run off and look for a place to set up a base together. They settled on the jungle which from spawn laid just past the desert with the combat arena and boat racetrack. In this jungle, the five of them quickly devoted themselves to something of a gameplay reset where they tried to start the game mostly from scratch in their jungle setup. It became a joke between the 5 of them that they were primitivists, they all created caveman skins and called their jungle setup Ooga Booga Land. Once they got a working Nether Portal, they proceeded to due multiple "expeditions", these trips where they would go to the nether tunnels, and crouch-sneak around the ROSS 2.0 smp area. Once they were seen by any given server member, they would run away and retreat back to Ooga Booga Land. On one expedition, they went to the base of Grey and Zandgall, where there was a running joke that QeorgeW had fallen in love with Grey. Ultimately, Zander and Isaac wound up visiting Ooga Booga land, and the server somewhat returned to normalcy. By then, it was late in the day, and the five had been playing for many hours, however this smp experience inspired these members to start a fresh new smp with Wanker Crew members and others. The next day, Zandgall joined Wanker crew to be able to talk with the Wanker Members, he remains as a member of the discord to this day. Evan was able to open a new smp Realm as "The Garden of Evan" on December 31st, 2020. After this, the ROSS 2.0 world was largely unplayed, and the Realm was used for things like Skyblock and minigames, until eventually zander stopped renewing his realms subscription.

builds.name: Lavacast Ruins
builds.description: A decorative area created by {p,DubTron,DubTron} and {p,zandgall,zandgall}.

images.caption: The formation of the first lavacast.
The formation of the second lavacast.
A better look at the finished first lavacast.
The entrance to the lavacast ruins from the {b,4,Nether Hub}

builds.name: Ocean Monument Farm
builds.description:
{p,BaconWaffle3213,BaconWaffle3213} soon after joining, had plans to completely clear out an ocean monument. There were many uses for an ocean monument, but also it would look cool as fuck. He, along with the help of {p,zandgall,zandgall} emptying the ocean monument found just 800 blocks north of spawn. You can see Isaac and Zander with a fully cleared out monument on June 24th{i,0}, before they then began to take out all the water out from around it{i,1}. The farm area was completely cleared out just around midnight of June 25th, and later that day, a guardian farm was fully constructed{i,2}.

The main focus of this Ocean Monument farm area was to create a guardian farm, in order to farm Prismarine shards and crystals. However, other farms were created here, such as an AFK fishing farm, along with a sugarcane farm{i,4}.

images.caption: The Monument itself after being completely cleared out.
The ocean monument in the process of being cleared of water on the outside.
The finished Guardian farm.
Something mischievous has happened here.............
The remains of an AFK Fishing farm, and a sugarcane farm.
Coral strewn out around the Ocean Monument.

builds.name: Arena (Ross 1)
builds.description: The arena was a small build created in the desert for people to fight eachother on. With the advent of {e,6,admin items} such as knockback sticks and other special enchanted items, the arena became a small popular area for people to duel with admin items.

builds.name: The End (Ross 1)
builds.description: Once the dragon was defeated, the prospect of making an enderman farm began. This became the main focus of the end island, beyond finding end cities for loot. {p,zandgall,Zandgall} Planned on making the enderman farm within the end island for some reason, and in order to make something like that efficient, the end needed to be covered in water. It took a few days, but once the end was fully covered in water, the farm could be created. They went with an interesting design at first, with a hole near the center of the island, where endermen would chase an endermite from a sectioned out dry portion of the land, into a hole, where they can be 1 shot{i,2}. This design, however, proved too finicky and difficult to get working, and so opted to build a big tower that proved easier to build, and more efficient{i,3}. The original farm was kept as an area to use enchanting tables and anvils{i,4}{i,5}.

images.caption: The end in the process of being coated in water.
Result of end pillaging.
The only remaining evidence of the original enderman farm design.
The current design of the enderman farm.
What became of the old farm.
The underground area of the old farm, now an enchanting area.
A pile up of endermen.
Gathering of XP through the use of the enderman farm.

builds.name: Spawn (Ross 1)
builds.description:
Spawn has been a running feature of Ross servers. A central hub where shops and events accrue. On Ross 1, Spawn was found in a village to the west of the {b,0,initial world spawn}. Spawn first became marked by The Fishbowl{i,0}, built by {p,DubTron,Dub} and {p,zandgall,Zander}. Once {p,BaconWaffle3213,BaconWaffle3213} joined the realm, the Spawn village became a good place to create shops. Some of the earliest being from BaconWaffle3213, his {b,2,Terracotta shop} migrating from Turtle Island, the {b,35,End Emporium}{i,2}, and the {b,36,Shulker Box Shop}. Shops from zandgall include the {b,19,Wool Shop}{i,4}, the {b,22,Rocket Shop}{i,5}, the {b,20,Concrete Shop}{i,6}, and the {b,21,Tavern}. DubTron build an {b,35,Enchanted Books Shop}, along with a {b,34,Potions Shop}. Other shops include {p,Grey_Phantom777,Grey's} {b,37,Bakery}, and {p,larzerboy,Larzerboy's} {b,38,Sand Shop}.

Other than shops, spawn village became home to several decorative builds. Including a decorative house built by BaconWaffle3213{i,7}, as well as another house built by BaconWaffle3213, this time with (unfinished) plans to expand it{i,8}. There was also a rocket (which was at first intended to be a shrimp) built by zandgall to celebrate the end of {s,Ross 1,Ross 1}, and the beginning of {s,Ross 2,Ross 2}{i,9}. Near the pathway to the Shrimp Rocket, there exists a floating wheat field on the ocean. Being there as a small communal farm{i,10}

One small feature of spawn was a one-off room, where {e,6,blank-white maps} lined the walls, removing any definition of the room, and making it easy to get lost despite being a tiny 3x3x3 area.{i,11}

There exists two community-specific builds. The {b,39,Police Station}{i,12}, and the {b,23,Admin Center}{i,13}{i,14}. The Police Station was intended to be a place to put people if they violated {e,10,Ross 1 Rules}, and were found guilty in {b,32,Dub's Courthouse.} As far as it is known, it has never been officially used. The Admin center however, was an inconspicuous house on the surface with an entrance into an underground area full of {e,6,custom maps}, a world map, and a section to suggest server rules, or gamerules.

Perhaps the biggest most detailed feature of spawn, {b,40,DubTron's Aquarium}{i,15} to the south-west between Spawn and {b,30,Dub's Base} was a massive building with a few small fish-tanks in the entrance area, along with a massive tank further south containing dolphins, and originally fish (the dolphins ate the fish.)

images.caption: The creation of the fishbowl, the beginning of spawn.
The escape of the villagers into the nether. This is the last known sighting of them.
The {b,35,End Emporium}, created by {p,BaconWaffle3213,BaconWaffle3213}.
The {b,36,Shulker Box Shop}
The {b,19,Wool Shop}
The {b,22,Rocket Shop}
The {b,20,Concrete Shop}
A decorative house built by {p,BaconWaffle3213,BaconWaffle3213}
Decorative house build by {p,BaconWaffle3213,BaconWaffle3213}, initially planned to be expanded.
The only available documented evidence of the Shrimp Rocket, built to commemorate the server, before Realm Reset.
The communal wheat farm.
The "infinite room."
The {b,39,Police Station}, with one open entrance room, and a jail cell to the left.
The outside of the {b,23,Admin Center.}
The inside of the Admin Center.
{p,DubTron,DubTron's} {b,40,Aquarium}.

builds.name: Wool Shop (Ross 1)
builds.description: The Wool Shop on {s,Ross 1,Ross 1} created by {p,zandgall,zandgall}, was one of the earlier shops built at {b,18,Spawn.} And it was created to sell wool gathered by zandgall's {b,42,Wool Farm}

images.caption: The result of overnight AFKing the wool farm.
Inside of the wool shop

builds.name: Concrete Shop (Ross 1)
builds.description: After the coalition of {g,pending,RocketPowered}, {p,zandgall,zandgall} created a new shop at {b,18,spawn.} That being, the Concrete Shop. As the name suggests it was a place to sell concrete.

images.caption: Inside the shop

builds.name: Tavern (Ross 1)
builds.description: The Tavern was a small cobblestone-based build at {b,18,spawn} where you could buy food items.

builds.name: Rocket Shop (Ross 1)
builds.description: The Rocket Shop. Built primarily by {p,zandgall,Zandgall}, with some help from {p,DubTron,DubTron}, right alongside the formation of {g,pending,RocketPowered.} Making this a dual-owned shop.

images.caption: Sky-view of the shop.

builds.name: Admin Center
builds.description: The admin center on {s,Ross 1,Ross 1} was an underground{i,0} area with 3 halls, each containing admin-related things. The western hall featured an edited world map, with markers for important areas{i,2}. The eastern hall featured several {e,6,custom maps} for players to use for fun{i,3}. And the northern hall featured several barrels where players could suggest server-wide {e,10,rules}, or gamerules.

images.caption: The entrance to the Admin Center.
View of the 3 halls.
The world map hall.
The {e,6,Custom Maps} hall.
The {e,10,rule} and gamerule suggestions hall.

builds.name: Grey's Base
builds.description:
{p,Grey_Phantom777,Grey's} base on {s,Ross 1,Ross 1} was a wooden spruce house on an island on top of a series of underground rooms and secret passageways, including hidden spots spread out from the island itself. Plastered around the island and secret rooms are signs that either depict something intended to be funny or cutesy, or something related to Grey's mental health, or her relationship with {p,zandgall,Zandgall.} Starting on the island itself, there are several decorative builds all around the island, many made out of wool{i,0}. Also within the confines of the island is a great big lagoon, filled with many fish and turtles{i,1}.

Inside the house, you have a ground floor with a bed and several named items and functional blocks around{i,2}. The basement meanwhile, facilitates storage with some more named items and functional blocks{i,3}. The house goes further down however, with an underground area with furnaces, pets, a pair of beds, and passageways to other rooms{i,4}, such as a diamond-block room to the south{i,5}.

To the west, is a staircase to a further labyrinth of rooms{i,6}{i,7}, with many more signs. This includes a infinity-map room, AFK fishing room, enchantment room, pet-fox chamber{i,8}, and a checkerboard hall.

Back outside of the house, there are several areas of note. In the ocean is a small hidden room with two flames kept in them{i,9}. Behind the house is an room filled with signs, with a nether portal{i,10}. South of the island, there is a small chicken-egg farm, in front of another wool creature{i,11}. Further south exists a cow farm, wheat and pumpkin farms, a horse stable, gravestones for dead pets, and a small sand house with nothing inside{i,12}. In the desert there are more points of interest. Such as the "UWU" spelling cacti{i,13}, the firehouse to the east{i,14}{i,15}, and a few more hidden underground locations. These include, another empty underground hideout in the ocean{i,16}, and underground jail-cell underneath the pumpkin patch{i,17}, and a hidden temple-looking underground series of staircases, containing signs pertaining to the relationship of the time{i,18}{i,19}.

images.caption: One of the many wool decorations that Grey had made spread about her base.
The turtle and fish lagoon, connected to the ocean, fenced in with glass panes. Contains many named fish and turtles.
The first floor of the house.
The first level of the basement.
The underground bedroom.
The diamond block room, with signs and a named item pertaining to the relationship.
The labyrinth of rooms.
Another angle of the labyrinth.
Three pet foxes, Flare, Blue, and Star.
Hidden room connected to the ocean.
The nether portal room, all of the signs say "Post Malone."
An egg farm with a wool creature in the back.
The sand area, with several farms, a horse stable, and an empty house.
The "UWU" cacti.
The outside of the 'fire house.'
The inside of the 'fire house,' with a glass floor protecting the player from fire underneath, and a lectern that sometimes carried a book.
Empty underground hideout, in the ocean near the cow farm.
The underground jail cell, with it's entrance right by the pumpkin patch.
The sealed hidden entrance to the sand temple.
The inside of the sand temple, showing 4 branching pathways.

The only documentation of another underground area, actually built by {p,zandgall,zandgall}, underneath the cow farm, filled with many rooms, and a redstone activated hidden entrance. (This build's location was verified by the coordinates shown in the top-left corner.)

The only documentation of a small underwater dome, containing two symbolic flowers. (This build's location was verified using the sandstone ocean ruin in the back, and the hill formation on the back-right.)

builds.name: Grey's Winter Area
builds.description: Late into the life of {s,Ross 1,Ross 1}, {p,Grey_Phantom777,Grey_Phantom777} created many decorative buildings to the south-west of {b,24,Grey's Base.} These builds include a hidden room to hide in{i,0}, a fire circle{i,1}, a small hideout at the bottom of a strip mine{i,2}, an empty arena-like tower{i,3}, a "GREG" sign{i,4}, a wooden spruce house{i,5}, and a suburban-looking light-blue house{i,6}. And finally, a small parkour-course, that is archived in just one screenshot of the waterfall entrance{i,7}. It is likely that other things have existed here, but have either been lost, forgotten, or simply have no way of confirming if they existed on this server in this area.

images.caption: A hidden room, often used literally for hiding.
The fire circle, you can see very little of what became a parkour arena via the waterfall on the right.
The underground hideout at the bottom of a strip mine.
The empty arena-esque tower.
The "GREG" sign.
The wooden spruce house.
The suburban looking light-blue house.
The only documentation of a parkour course created in this winter area.

builds.name: Underwater Bunker
builds.description: The underwater bunker, created by {p,Grey_Phantom777,Grey_Phantom777} had 4 wings to it{i,0}. The northern wing was a big empty chamber{i,1}, the eastern wing held a jail cell{i,2}, the western wing had an iron-door trap{i,3}, and the southern wing was another chamber, with a secret passageway to a tiny room through the bottom trapdoor at the end of the room{i,4}.

images.caption: A view of the whole underwater bunker.
The northern wing.
The eastern wing, hosting a small jail cell.
The western wing, sporting a iron-door trap.
The southern wing.
A hidden passageway at the far end of the southern wing.

builds.name: RocketPowered HQ
builds.description: {g,pending,RocketPowered} had a lot of farming goals, and so created a headquarters in order to facilitate several small-scale farms. These included a cactus-bonemeal-green-dye hybrid farm, and a bee farm, though more was planned.

images.caption: A railway connecting the main building with the bee farm.
The bee farm.
The ground floor of the headquarters.
The second level of the headquarters, showing the cactus hybrid farm on the left, farm storage in the back, and the railway to the bee farm on the right.
The entrance to the headquarters from the nether.

builds.name: RocketPowered Storage
builds.description: As part of {g,pending,RocketPowered}, {p,zandgall,zandgall} and {p,DubTron,DubTron} created this dual-storage facility.

images.caption: The inside of the storage facility.
The inconspicuous entrance in a waterfall.

builds.name: Creeper Farm (Ross 1)
builds.description: A farm created by {p,zandgall,zandgall} with help from {p,DubTron,DubTron} in order to gather large amounts of gunpowder, leading up to the formation of {g,pending,RocketPowered.}

images.caption: One of the layers, with magma below.

builds.name: DubTron's Base (Ross 1)
builds.description: {p,DubTron,DubTron's} base was one of the earlier bases on the realm. Built just to the west of spawn, it's a mountain base with many different features. On top of the base, is a Pokemon pixel art piece created by {p,BaconWaffle3213,BaconWaffle3213}{i,0}. Inside the base you will find storage{i,2}, a chicken farm{i,3}, and a cow farm{i,4}{i,5}. To the right is a staircase down to the mines, along with a nether portal to the {b,4,Nether Hub}{i,6}. Inside the portal room, there is also scaffolding that will take you down a level, where you'll find an unfinished infinity-map-room, and a wooden and cobble hideout room{i,7}. Down the staircase to the mines, there is a small room containing pets, along with a line of campfires that you can ride and spam click food into in order to cook things rather quickly{i,8}. Outside the main house, there is a entrance up on top of the main base{i,9}, where you can find a full-power beacon and some fish{i,10}. Further outside the base, there is a turtle pond, full of named turtles{i,11}.

images.caption: Pixel art created by {p,BaconWaffle3213,BaconWaffle3213} above the base.
The front of the base.
The inside of the base.
The chicken farm.
The back of the chicken farm, as well as the breeding portion of the cow farm.
The back of the cow farm
Staircase downwards, along with the nether portal to the {b,4,Nether Hub.}
Underground area, with a lit-up map room, and a small hideout.
Down to the mines, a fire pit area used to quickly cook food, along with a small pet room.
A ladder + water from outside the house to the top floor.
The top floor, with a beacon and a small fish area.
Turtle bay, full of turtles, each with their own names, sex, and partner, as described in a book off to the side.

builds.name: DubTron's Museum
builds.description: DubTron's museum was a small build between {b,18,Spawn} and {b,30,DubTron's Base.}

builds.name: DubTron's Village (NEEDS DATE)
builds.description: {p,DubTron,DubTron's} Village was a decorative build right outside {b,30,his base}, spreading towards {b,18,spawn.} It had 6 buildings before reset, and only 5 in the last remaining archive of {s,Ross 1,Ross 1.} The house at the end of the village was a court house{i,0}, where {e,8,a court case happened.} The next two houses are stables, one for horses{i,1} and the other for llamas{i,2}. The remaining houses are decorative, featuring a birch house{i,3}, a polished stone house{i,4}, and an oak wood house{i,5}.

images.caption: The court house, where the {e,8,court case} happened.
The horse stable.
The llama stable.
The birch house.
The polished stone house.
The oak wood house.

builds.name: Potion Shop (Ross 1)
builds.description: The potion shop was an unfinished shop created by {p,DubTron,DubTron.} As it is empty, there is nothing much to talk about than to see how it looks.

images.caption: The empty inside.

builds.name: Enchanted Books Shop (Ross 1)
builds.description: The enchanted books shop is a shop created by {p,DubTron,DubTron}, which stocked several different random types of enchanted books. Stocked in a way so that all books deemed to be 1 diamond of value are in their own chest, books that are 2 diamonds have their own chest, same with 3 and 4 diamond books, and finally mending books, which are 10 diamonds each. The shop later became property of {g,pending,RocketPowered.}

images.caption: The inside of the shop, showing the carpet floor, the chests with the books, and a burning cauldron.

builds.name: End Emporium
builds.description: The end emporium was a shop run by {p,BaconWaffle3213,BaconWaffle3213} relatively early into the game, selling loot pillaged from end ships. Ender dragon heads, Elytras, Armor, Tools and End Rods.

builds.name: Shulker Box Shop (Ross 1)
builds.description: The Shulker Box Shop was a shop run by {p,BaconWaffle3213,BaconWaffle3213}, that simply sold Shulker Boxes for 5 diamonds a box.

builds.name: Bakery (Ross 1)
builds.description: The bakery was a small shop created by {p,Grey_Phantom777,Grey_Phantom777} at {b,18,Spawn}. You could buy baked goods here like bread, cookies, and other things.

builds.name: Sand Shop
builds.description: The sand shop was a small shop at spawn simply selling sand, lots of it.

builds.name: Police Station (Ross 1)
builds.description: The police station was a semi-decorative build created by {p,zandgall,zandgall} and {p,DubTron,DubTron.} It was created in response to some of DubTron's items being taken. This bore {e,10,The Law.} What's lesser known about this build, is the dark rampage that was taken once these unfortunate individuals gained their power. Many innocents were locked up in a fit of paranoia, the items weren't being found. Until one day zandgall 'mysteriously' found them in an abandoned ship wreck near spawn. DubTron rightfully questioned zandgall about this, which sent them into a fit of rage, bursting out at DubTron for daring to question his authority and loyalty. Such a rage had never been seen on Ross, and wouldn't be seen again until {s,Ross 2,Ross 2.} It is hard to overstate how drastic the situation was, zandgall began a rampage of interrogations, trying to find who 'might have taken these items.' But it was a lost cause, and somewhere in their cracked psyche, they knew that. Things escalated as members started to refuse interrogation requests, citing stupid reasons like "the items have already been found," "you already interrogated me," "i think this is going too far." the person who stole the items was still out there, and they had to find them. as the situation escalated, and the thief refused to reveal themself, zandgall began to take more drastic measures that he thought would only be last resorts. he began to travel out to see the other ross members in person, one occurrence even requiring a plane flight,. but i had to do everything i could to seek justice. strangely all the participants started to fight back and claimed i was taking things too far. i had a feeling at that point that everyone else was in on it. they had all taken the items, and were hiding it from me. they were conspiring with eachother to make sure the truth never came out, no matter hwo hard i hit them. but there are uncomfortable things we must do for justice, and i dont take stolen items lightly. finally, one of them confessed. i immediately knew they were being thrown under the bus by the others, and i scoured the room to find them, i know they were there watching me, but i could never find them. to this day no one else has admitted to taking part in the theft of these valuable items. but justice has to wait, things get ugly real quickb when these scheming criminals know what i am doing. i must first isolate myself so that they can't see me coming. justice will come one day.

images.caption: someone locked up, they turned out to be innocent.
this interrogation went wrong, they pushed their luck and forced my hand.

builds.name: DubTron's Aquarium (Ross 1)
builds.description: {p,DubTron,DubTron's} Aquarium was a massive decorative build at {b,18,spawn.} It had a big open entrance, with fish tanks in the upper level, and a massive tank to the back that housed dolphins.

images.caption: The entrance to the Aquarium.
The hall down to the giant tank.
A fishtank, with two fish names shown, Butterflyfish and Tomato Clownfish.
The same fishtank with the other two fish names, Cichlid and Triggerfish
An empty fishtank.
The giant open tank with the Dolphins Triton, Sea Nymph, Child of Poseidon, and Guardian of Atlantis.

builds.name: Nether House (Ross 1)
builds.description: The nether house was a decorative build created by {p,Grey_Phantom777,Grey} and {p,zandgall,Zander} in the nether of {s,Ross 1,Ross 1.} This build served a big stone house with a small landscape outside.

images.caption: A wide angle showing the edits to the terrain around, including 'nether trees' (this was pre-1.16) made of glowstone, soul sand, and magma.
The "living room" with its bay window and kitchen.
The other side of the living room, showcasing a fireplace.
A side room with a television and a staircase up a floor.
The upper bedroom.
The main room as a whole, including an upstairs with a working sofa in front of another bay window.

builds.name: Zandgall's Base (Ross 1)
builds.description: {p,zandgall,Zandgall's} base came to form around the 4th of July, as a fully fledged farm and base area separate from {b,0,Turtle Island.} At the center of the base there is a house, which exists mainly to house a bed and to be pretty{i,1}{i,2}. Around the base there are several farms, like a cobblestone farm{i,3}{i,4}, a super smelter (which automatically smelts some cobble from the cobble farm into stone){i,5}, a wool farm which gathers wool of all colors{i,6}{i,7}, a concrete farm in which the player simply places powdered concrete on a designated block, from which it will be wet into concrete blocks, and blown up and collected{i,8}. A basic makeshift iron farm was in progress{i,9}, and two renditions of a slime farm, one that was just a simple wide open underground area{i,10}, and another that was intended to be more of a fully automated slime farm{i,11}. And finally, from what last documentation exists, a villager breeder{i,12}. These villagers were likely used in {b,43,Zandgall's Village} to the southwest.

images.caption: Top-down view of a majority of the base.
The first floor of the house.
The second floor of the house.
The auto-cobblestone farm.
Storage to the cobblestone farm, with a sign stating the ownership of {g,pending,RocketPowered.}
The mini super-smelter.
The wool farm.
Result of AFK-ing the wool farm overnight.
The concrete farm.
The iron farm.
An underground area used for farming slime.
An actual slime farm.
A villager breeder room with many villagers running about.

builds.name: Zandgall's Village
builds.description: On {s,Ross 1,Ross 1}, in order to obtain enchanted books and other goods, {p,zandgall,Zandgall} created a village, which had a farm to obtain emeralds from farmers{i,0}, and a trader area in order to obtain enchanted books and other valuable goods{i,1}. (Both of which are currently unpopulated, likely to world corruption or an error in changing versions.)

images.caption: The currently unpopulated farm.
The currently unpopulated trading area.

builds.name: The Pokeball
builds.description: The Pokeball was a decorative build created by {p,zandgall,zandgall}, {p,DubTron,DubTron}, and {p,BaconWaffle3213,BaconWaffle3213} all together somewhat as an event.

images.caption: The Pokeball currently in progress.

builds.name: The Hook
builds.description: The hook was a decorative build. It's exact date of creation is unknown, but it's speculated that {p,lazytagger,lazytagger} used a modded client in order to build it.

builds.name: Witch Farm (Ross 1)
builds.description: The witch farm was a farm created by {p,zandgall,zandgall.}

images.caption: The inner mechanisms to the farm.

builds.name: NoobRekt's Base
builds.description: Flat little area somewhat close to {b,42,zandgall's base.}

builds.name: Moonlight Hot Springs
builds.description: A decorative build created far away from everything else by {p,Grey_Phantom777,Grey_Phantom777.} It's exact date of creation is unknown.

images.caption: The actual hot springs.

builds.name: Mob Farm (Ross 1)
builds.description: The mob farm was created in order to get XP before the {b,17,enderman farm} was constructed.

images.caption: The inside of the farm.
The farm's pickup spot, along with a sign declaring this farm property of {g,pending,RocketPowered.}

builds.name: Bee Dome
builds.description: The bee dome was a small bee farm close to {b,18,Spawn}, it housed several bees and had a lot of decorative features to it.

images.caption: The dome from the inside.

builds.name: The Church
builds.description: The church was a build created by {p,Grey_Phantom777} while planning to have wedding events.

builds.name: Sugarcane Farm (Ross 1)
builds.description: The sugarcane farm is a small 3-story farm that automatically gathers sugarcane. It was used by {g,pending,RocketPowered} in order to make a lot of {b,22,firework rockets.}

images.caption: The inside of the farm.

builds.name: Creative World
builds.description: The creative world was a separate world from {s,Ross 1,Ross 1}, and it held a couple different things to do. There were little redstone contraptions spread out everywhere, including a giant lag machine created by {p,lazytagger,lazytagger.} The two minigames in this area however are of focus. The first being a bow arena created by {p,DubTron,DubTron}{i,0}, with a slime-block contraption at the bottom to bounce you up into the arena{i,1}. Along with a hide-and-seek game, where the player will be made invisible, and a block will spawn in at their feet. Switching your selected hotbar slot will switch the block that displays at your position. Your goal is to hide in the arena while a seeker with a power 255 bow tries to find you{i,2}<sup>-</sup>{i,7}.

images.caption: The bow arena.
The launchpad into the bow arena.
The entrance to the hide and seek arena.
Hide and seek second floor.
Hide and seek third floor.
Tower with the levitating command block up to the top of the arena.
The top of the arena, a huge watchtower.
The mechanics of hide and seek.

zandgall.description: This guy, I dont believe this guy. He runs the thing

LordStarscream.description: The second person to be a part of Ross, before it was even known as Ross.

BaconWaffle3213.description: One of the earliest core Ross members. There since Ross 1. The Ocean Monument guy.

larzerboy.description: One of the first Ross members

groups.name: RocketPowered
groups.description: RocketPowered was a coalition between {p,zandgall,zandgall} and {p,DubTron,DubTron.} Usually spending their time as a group building and maintaining farms and shops.
